Description: Tomb-relief fragment: parts of three lines of good, incised hieroglyphs contain the titles and dignities of a high official; one of the titles makes him Controller of Secrets of the Pyramid (?) of Nyuserra. There has been considerable surface weathering at the top of the piece, but no signs are completely lost. The surface is now firm. No colour remains.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.22)
Condition: Incomplete; there has been considerable surface weathering at the top of the piece, but no signs are completely lost.
